title: "Dead Man’s Plate remains too strong and is crowding out other choices"
body:
No, it is not too strong. This is not the reason why people are not buying other armor items.
It is because you made every armor item so bad, that it is hard to choose something different from dead's man plate.
Thornmail is a noob trap, Frozen Heart is a niche item, Randuins passive is also niche, Sunfire is just...Worse than dead's man plate( buff it instead of nerfing even more DMP). And I can't remember any armor items except {{item:3026}}  that's well....has a very specific use and {{item:3157}}  which is a AP mage item.
We either need more armor item options, or you will nerf all of them to the point that we will have no reason to even buy them

Heroes of the Storm had a level 20 talent in Technical Alpha that allowed the player to respawn in 5 seconds every 180 seconds.

Then Bolt of the Storm (double the distance of {{summoner:4}}  with half the cooldown) got nerfed when people ~~abused~~picked it.

league had revive too, and it was removed because it didn't offer any interesting gameplay.  Flash actually requires serious decisions because not having it up can be fatal against anyone who knows to abuse it, and it's very easy to waste it when you either didn't need to use it,  or it wouldn't have mattered.  Flash ultimately adds a lot of depth to interactions which is why it's ultimately a healthy thing for the game, which is why riot's never bothered reworking it and hasn't nerfed it in ages despite it being omnipresent on all but a few champs.  There's a difference between something getting picked up all the time because it's too strong and something being picked all the time because it adds strategic options.  This is the core difference between flash and thunderlords.  Thunderlords doesn't add gameplay, it just ensures that whoever has a better 3 hit combo wins more trades.

iceborn gauntlet has less armor. 25 less armor. its a lot. considering all the armor pen and armor reduction items.

As you consider %armor pen, the gap between the two armor values shrinks by the same percentage, making Iceborn even better, due to the way armor works.

For example with 90 and 65 the difference is 25. At 45% armor pen, the values are 49.5 and 35.75 or a 13.75 armor gap. 

Math check: 25 * .55 (or the armor gap modified by penetration) is 13.75

So as %penetration goes up, the two values get closer together. Flat pen is a different story though.

IBG is not a good item for Amumu. His base AD is surprisingly low (tanky melee champions tend to have high base AD, but Amumu breaks this rule) and he rely on E to constantly proc the passive, and he can't always stick reliably enough. Also, you are better off building AP items if you want damage; Rylai is one of them, and it provides the same slow and stickness that IBG would provide but in a way that Amumu can take better advantage of.

I think it's both, they really should remove the slow on auto from Deadman's and increase the damage it does for the auto instead. It should be a selfish item for getting yourself to the enemy, the slow makes it so any tanky initiater would want it too. 

At the same time, they've nerfed a lot of the reasons to pick other tank items, Randuins lost the slow upon being attacked, Frozen Heart got its attack speed aura reduced, and Righteous Glory got gutted. They should remove the crit reduction on Randuins and give it back the movement speed slow on being attacked and make a new armor item that gives the crit reduction. Make Frozen Heart reduce attack speed by 20%. Make the passive of Sunfire toggleable. And give Righteous Glory some armor by making it build from Catalyst and Raptor Cloak and give it back the Catalyst passive.

we have a weird situation in league right now. full ad comps should ALWAYS suffer for having only ad champs, especially against heavy tank comps, but it's not the case now. they just build armor pen + have innate tank shreding skills, and there we go, they fly through tanks like they were made from paper. i don't think that this is healthy, especially that it was balanced way better in seasons 1/2/3

Of course Dead Man's Plate is the number one armor choice when it gives movement speed. Just like you always buy boots in every game. It's a mobility-based game, a long cd AoE slow or a weak aoe damage passive is never going to contest with the ability to catch up to enemies or escape death. As long as it is worth buying, it will always be prioritized. I honestly don't know what they're expecting players to buy or what kind of variation they even want to see.

If the active buffed an allied turret to clear waves better, it'd be an amazing tank item that you'd get against siege comps.
